title: Storm Ciaran: France's Atlantic and Channel coasts expect heavy rain and winds up to 170 km/h
summary: Parts of Brittany and Normandy are on 'red alert' for strongs winds, with the rest of the northwest on 'orange alert.' On Thursday, several public transport lines across 6 regions including Paris will be suspended, as well as a ban on truck traffic in Brittany.

title: 76 wounded Palestinians and 335 foreigners in first evacuations from Gaza, refugee camp struck again
summary: The Rafah crossing opened on Wednesday for the first time in more than three weeks of brutal conflict to allow the evacuation of dozens of injured Palestinians requiring hospital treatment and hundreds of foreign passport holders.

title: Paris 2024 opening ceremony: Authorities consider admitting around 300,000 spectators for free
summary: A defense and security council meeting is scheduled for the end of November. The public authorities are finalizing the arrangements for screening, security controls and crowd control.

title: French telecom group Altice is on a precipice
summary: Patrick Drahi may be playing down Altice's colossal debt, but inflation and rising interest rates are forcing him to take on more debt. The company is teetering on the brink. His business partner's arrest in July, SFR's stagnation and this financial risk may push it over the edge.

title: Macron visits Central Asia to 'strengthen, complement and accelerate' partnerships
summary: Macron signed a series of contracts with Kazakhstan, which already supplies 40% of France's uranium, and is the first French president to go to Uzbekistan since 1994.

title: Sweden wants people to stop confusing it with Switzerland
summary: After a slip-up by Joe Biden, the Swedish tourist board has launched a humorous campaign to highlight the differences between the two countries and repair the country's tarnished image.

title: US House fails to expel congressman George Santos
summary: The scandal-plagued congressman easily survived a vote Wednesday to expel him from the House as most Republicans and 31 Democrats opted to withhold punishment while both his criminal trial and a House Ethics Committee investigation proceed.

title: Russian oligarch Alexei Kuzmichev charged in France with tax fraud
summary: The business tycoon, considered one of the 'most influential people in Russia' and an associate of Vladimir Putin, was arrested in Saint-Tropez on Monday.

title: Disney to complete takeover of Hulu with $8.6 billion deal
summary: The deal values Hulu at $27.5 billion in total, according to Disney, which said the transaction will be concluded by December 1.

title: Donald Trump Jr. testifies at his father's civil fraud trial
summary: The son of the former US president took the stand on Wednesday denying direct involvement in his father's financial statements. The lawsuit alleges a conspiracy to inflate the former president's wealth, putting his real estate empire at risk.

title: Matthew Perry, elegy for a sad clown
summary: The actor, who died on October 28, was the most constructed and endearing character in the cult series 'Friends'.

title: Israel-Hamas war: 25 days of incessant bombing on the people of Gaza
summary: Thousands of buildings razed to the ground, more than 8,000 dead and 1.4 million displaced: Israel has been carrying out strikes on densely populated areas in Gaza and imposing a siege on this vast open-air prison.

title: US Fed votes to maintain high interest rates
summary: The US Federal Reserve kept interest rates at a 22-year high for a second straight meeting, noting that 'economic activity expanded at a strong pace in the third quarter.'

title: 'Carbon bombs': TotalEnergies is the world's second-largest extractor from huge deposits
summary: From Uganda to Kazakhstan, from the Russian Arctic to Norway and Brazil, the French group is linked to at least 23 giant hydrocarbon extraction sites, as an operator or shareholder

title: Peace Prize winner Narges Mohammadi's message from behind bars
summary: The activist and journalist expressed her 'sincere gratitude' to the Nobel Committee, lionized the 'non-violent and unstoppable' human rights movement in Iran, and concluded hopefully: 'Victory is not easy, but it is certain.'

title: Second man to receive experimental pig heart transplant dies
summary: Lawrence Faucette, who was suffering from a terminal heart disease, lived for almost six weeks after the genetically modified pig heart was transplanted into his body.

title: France's Sénat proposes law against inclusive writing to 'protect the French language'
summary: On Monday, the Sénat voted for an extensive ban on gender-inclusive writing. President Emmanuel Macron called to 'not give in to the zeitgeist.'

title: In Germany, the wealthiest fear losing their parental leave allowance
summary: A heated debate is unfolding around a specific bill to abolish parental leave allowance for families with annual taxable incomes above €150,000.

title: Hurricane Otis exposes urban planning flaws in Acapulco
summary: According to initial estimates, 580,000 people have lost their homes, 7,000 hectares of buildings have been destroyed or damaged and over 900 kilometers of roads and streets have been flooded or damaged.

title: Unlikely pro-Russian and pro-EU coalition forms in Montenegro
summary: Newly appointed Montenegrin Prime Minister Milojko Spajic has formed a coalition with ethnic Serbian parties hostile to the West. The former Goldman Sachs banker defends the geopolitical leap, claiming that his government's program has been accepted by all.

title: Why is the United States Israel's closest ally?
summary: Since Hamas's October 7 attack on Israel and the Jewish state's response in the Gaza Strip, the United States has once again affirmed its firm support for Israel.

title: Who are the diehard French jihadists in a Syrian 'mini-caliphate'?
summary: The 220 French nationals still present on Syrian soil have retreated to territory controlled by an Islamist group that has officially renounced global jihad. But intelligence services believe that some of them still represent a threat to France.

title: Biden calls for a humanitarian 'pause' in Israel-Hamas war
summary: Responding to a heckler during a campaign speech, the US president voiced support for a humanitarian 'pause' in the conflict, marking a shift in the administration's stance, which had previously refrained from dictating Israeli military operations.

title: Texas Rangers win first-ever World Series title
summary: The Texas Rangers secured their first World Series championship in franchise history on Wednesday with a 5-0 victory over the Arizona Diamondbacks.

title: Storm Ciaran in pictures: Record-breaking gusts hit western France
summary: Power cuts and road closures continued in western France on Thursday morning after Storm Ciaran brought a night of extreme wind and rain.

title: Storm Ciaran rages through France and Britain with record winds
summary: 1.2 million homes in western France were left without electricity after Storm Ciaran hit on Wednesday night and Thursday morning.
